DOC.brief_summary: Women undergoing their first second or third cesarean section will be randomized into two groups. One group will have the abdominal bandage removed at 6 hours post-surgery and the other group will have the bandage removed at 24 hours. Staple removal will be at 5 - 7 days for both groups. The incision will be inspected at the time of staple removal. The 2 groups will be compared for incision disruption and infection. Also, the women will be asked about their satisfaction for time of bandage removal.
DOC.criteria: age of 18 to 44 elective cesarean section, primary or repeat low risk pregnancy under the age of 18 and above the age of 44 diabetes, preeclampsia or other pregnancy complications unable or unwilling to give informed consent chorioamnionitis BMI over 35 more than 3 cesareans
